version_description:
- If you set streaming over cellular data to "Never", you will now be prompted with "Always, Just Once, or Never Again" when attempting to stream over data for the second time.
- Minor bug fixes.

- Full iPhone X support
- Bug fixes and performance improvements
- We've fixed the height of the minimized player for display on the iPhone X

* Simplified sign in coming soon! With Shaw ID, you can create one login to access all your Shaw services and products and give each of your household members their own Shaw ID to use with FreeRange TV, Shaw Go WiFi. Starting in April, Shaw ID will be the only logical credential accepted by FreeRange TV. Set yours up now at https://register.shaw.ca/, or for Shaw Direct https://register.shawdirect.ca.
* We’ve added a zoom button to the video player, allowing you to choose to have the video fill the entire iPhone X display.
* Parental Control PIN prompts can now be set to Snooze for 1, 2, or 4 hours.
* We fixed an issue where programs were watched would not be marked as ‘Watched’.
-  We've added menus and menu collections to search results
- This version includes various fixes and enhancements.

* We've redesigned the Player Controls, moving the Play/Pause and Skip buttons front and centre.
* We've added the option to restart a Live TV title from the beginning when a VOD version of that title is available.
* Navigate to the Downloads screen is now the default action on download notifications.
* Dates, times, and numbers are now formatted using your system-defined region format.

* We're transitioning the login for FreeRange TV to Shaw ID - a faster and easier way to access all of your favourite Shaw services. Get started now with your account number and a preferred email address at https://register.shaw.ca/
* We've fixed a few bugs in our new player controls.
We've tweaked Recently Watched layout: posters are now displayed in landscape orientation and content plays automatically when you tap it, rather than displaying content details.
-We've tweaked the status bar animation when showing/hiding player controls
Various bug fixes

- Binge watching! When watching an On Demand series, the next episode will be shown and played in the player.
- We've fixed an issue where the closed captions switch always appears toggled on.
- We've resolved an issue affecting our new Binge Watching feature.

* We've tweaked Binge Watching a bit more.
* We've added a Mini Player which allows watching video content in a smaller window (like Pip on iPads).

* To ensure that you can always watch the FreeRange TV content included in your TV plan subscription, FreeRange TV now uses your devices location services to determine if your device is located within Canada, resolving an issue where devices may have been blocked from streaming if it received an IP address incorrectly located outside of Canada
* We've added support for Siri Shortcuts for the main screens in FreeRange TV.
* We've added support for new iPad Pro form factor.

- FreeRange TV now uses your devices location services permission to determine if your device is located within Canada to ensure that you can watch the FreeRange TV content included in your TV plan subscription.
- We've fixed a few minor accessibility defects.

- BlueSky TV customers can now download any new PVR recordings to take on the go with FreeRange TV! This feature is available in Calgary and select surrounding areas now and will expand to other regions at a later date.
- We've added French language support for devices set to French!
- Minimum iOS version supported is now iOS 10.3

- We updated Skip Forward & Scrub functionality in the Player to allow you to skip forward to the end of playback, even if there are less than 30 seconds left in playback. Skipping to the end will take you to the last 5 seconds of the title.
- We resolved an incorrect cover art issue on TV episodes

We’ve added some improvements for Binge Watching!
- When your scrub to the end of a video, the Up Next end card will display
- When you’ve watched more than 85% of a Recording and the player is closed, the Recording will be marked as “Watched” and you’ll be given the option to delete the Recording.
- When you’ve watched more than 85% of a Downloaded Video and the player is closed, the Downloaded Video will be marked as “Watched” and you’ll be given the option to return the Downloaded Video.

- We've made some improvements to the Login experience
- We’ve update the Auto-Play setting description to reflect the new user experience
- We've made some UI improvements
- We've killed off a bunch of bugs

• The minimum supported iOS version is now iOS 11
• FreeRange TV will no resume playback after an audio interruption
• We've fixed a bunch of bugs

- Minor user experience improvements
- Improved language support
- We've fixed a bunch of bugs
FreeRange TV is now BlueCurve TV! You can still enjoy live sports and on demand content on-the-go as you always have!
- We've fixed a few bugs
- We've fixed a few bugs
We've added some performance improvements and fixed a few bugs with this update
We've added some performance improvements and fixed a few bugs with this update
We've fixed a few bugs and added some performance improvements
Bug fixes and enhancements
